videos.headline: Authorities are responding to a major fire incident in Mumbai.
videos.description:
A fire broke out earlier today in a commercial building in Mumbai.

According to fire department officials,
multiple fire engines were rushed to the scene.

Emergency teams are currently working to control the situation
and ensure the safety of nearby residents.

Authorities have confirmed that evacuation procedures were carried out
as a precaution.

The exact cause of the fire is still under investigation.

More official details are expected soon.

👉 Follow for verified updates from across India.

videos.headline: Authorities are investigating a shooting in Rhode Island.
videos.description:
A shooting incident has been reported in Rhode Island,
with local law enforcement responding to the scene.

Officials confirmed that an investigation is currently underway.
Emergency services were deployed, and the area was secured.

At this time, authorities have not released full details
regarding suspects or motives.

Residents in the area were advised to avoid the location
while police conduct their investigation.

More information is expected as officials provide updates.

👉 Follow for verified news updates only.

videos.headline: Ramadan 2026 — when will it begin?
videos.description:
Ramadan in 2026 is expected to begin around the evening of February 17th or 18th, depending on moon sighting.

Since the Islamic calendar follows the lunar cycle,
the exact date is confirmed only after the crescent moon is seen.

Different countries may announce slightly different start dates
based on local moon observations.

Ramadan is a sacred month of fasting, prayer, and reflection
for Muslims worldwide.

Stay tuned for official confirmation closer to the date.

👉 Follow for fast global updates.

videos.headline: U.K. Deputy PM calls Delhi summit ‘important moment' to unlock full benefits of AI
videos.description: The U.K. delegation, led by Deputy Prime Minister David Lammy and AI Minister Kanishka Narayan, is keen to highlight how AI can improve everyday life in every corner of the world and make the case for AI as an engine of renewal that can help doctors diagnose faster, teachers personalise learning, councils deliver services in minutes and businesses create the next generation of good jobs.
